intro: Linociera minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered linociera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub with opposite, simple leaves. Its flowers are clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Linociera minutiflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
